diagnosis.name: Activity Intolerance
diagnosis.definition: Insufficient physiologic or psychological energy to endure or complete required or desired daily activities.

outcome.name: Activity Tolerance
outcome.definition: Physiologic response to energy-consuming movements with daily activities

outcome.name: Endurance
outcome.definition: Capacity to sustain activity

outcome.name: Energy Conservation
outcome.definition: Personal actions to manage energy for initiating and sustaining activity

outcome.name: Physical Fitness
outcome.definition: Performance of physical activities with vigor

outcome.name: Psychomotor Energy
outcome.definition: Personal drive and energy to maintain activities of daily living, nutrition,and personal safety

outcome.name: Self-Care: Activities of Daily Living (ADL)
outcome.definition: Ability to perform the most basic physical tasks and personal care activities independently with or without assistive device

outcome.name: Self-Care: Instrumental Activities of Daily Living (IADL)
outcome.definition: Ability to perform activities needed to function in the home or community independently with or without assistive device

diagnosis.name: Adjustment, Impaired
diagnosis.definition: Inability to modify life style/behavior in a manner consistent with a change in health status.

outcome.name: Acceptance: Health Status
outcome.definition: Reconciliation to significant change in health circumstances

outcome.name: Adaptation to Physical Disability
outcome.definition: Adaptive response to a significant functional challenge due to a physical disability

outcome.name: Motivation

outcome.name: Psychosocial Adjustment: Life Change

diagnosis.name: Anxiety
diagnosis.definition: Vague uneasy feeling of discomfort or dread accompanied by an autonomic response (the source often nonspecific or unknown to the individual); a feeling of apprehension caused by anticipation of danger. It is an altering signal that warns of impending danger and enables the individual to take measures to deal with threat.
